the negcon, a playstation controller made for ridge racer. The middle twists so it could be used for the rotation, with the 4 directional pad for movements. outside of the limits for like 8 directions it has potential.

Could you probably implement it for the sake of doing so? Absolutely.
Should you use it in competition? No, probably not. The D pad resolution would be terrible compared to a traditional stick and you are very much limited to cardinal directions.

That is unless next year’s game is FIRST Chess presented by Haas and Chess.com a part of the 2026 Season: Sand presented by Qualcomm.

We tried this X-Box controller steering knob hack in 2023. The result didn’t noticeably increase performance:

Experiments with a Swerve "Steering Knob" CD-Media: Papers
Last year was the first year our team competed in the regular season with a swerve drive chassis. We noticed that our drivers spent a lot more time than expected lining up with the various field targets (double substation, grid, and game pieces on the field floor). During one of our debriefs, we discussed whether the control scheme we used was the best way to translate driver intent into robot action. That discussion led to an idea: What if there was a better interface for driving swerve? …

To be honest, now I kinda wanna try driving a good field oriented swerve+an elevator with one of these, it feels like it could be a quite intuitive control scheme.

That still leaves us with two axes(pitch and roll), and even though pitch might be intuitive enough for an arm, I think the opportunities for accidentally triggering wrong inputs would be too high.

Negcon was THE best racing controller for the PS1. Analogue steering, analogue buttons. Most PS1 racing games used it. All Ridge racer games, Wipeout 1 & 2 You could use it for all Namco games even Tekken. Wish they made a mordern version.
